diff_hunk:
@@ -23,13 +23,8 @@ function bazel_clean_and_fetch() {
   # TODO(pcloudy): Re-enable it after bazel clean --expunge is fixed.
   if ! is_windows; then
     bazel clean --expunge
-    # TODO(https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2220) Remove the nested `bazel query`.
-    bazel fetch $(bazel query "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/...")
-  else
-    # TODO(pcloudy): Also filter out //tensorflow/examples/android/... on Windows after
-    # https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/2248 is fixed.
-    bazel fetch //tensorflow/...
   fi
+  bazel fetch "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/..."
body: @meteorcloudy why do you say that? It should work on Linux with the next Bazel release. The reason that I added the `bazel fetch $(bazel query "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/...")` line in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/6225 was to ensure that configure would work with Bazel from HEAD.
body_html: @meteorcloudy why do you say that? It should work on Linux with the next Bazel release. The reason that I added the bazel fetch $(bazel query "//tensorflow/... -//tensorflow/examples/android/...") line in #6225 was to ensure that configure would work with Bazel from HEAD.
